data.title: Bickering Critics
data.meta_description: Posts about Bruce Cabot written by cobblerjon
data.text:
First the murder of a good man in order to acquire his ranch. Second the lying and cheating and snide bravado of the killers and the rich man behind it. Third the well-deserved retribution administered by the murdered man’s daughter … Continue reading →

Starts with an Overture of 4:14, and then shows the RKO radio tower beeping away.Then the film begins with a old Arabian proverb: “And lo, the beast looked upon the face of beauty. And it stayed its hand from killing. … Continue reading →

Bob and Damon Runyon turn out to be a good combination. Sorrowful is part of horse-racing. He takes bets, places bets, works with tough guys and hustlers, and still manages to try for a relationship with Gladys O’Neill (Lucille Ball), … Continue reading →

As a youngster I saw this musical performed on stage. You never saw sand or horsemen, but the plot was clear and the glorious songs carried you right along. The one I remember most distinctly was called (I think) The … Continue reading →

At the elementary school where Hildegarde teaches, Otto (Fredrik Vogeding) the janitor is finishing prep work and opening the door to let the students in. Secretary to the Principal Jane Davis (Gertrude Michael) enters her outer office and puts a … Continue reading →

Well okay, now we can clear up some plot lines. The opening card reads: “1757 – The Seven Years’War shakes Europe. France and England fight on three continents. With North America at stake George III, “German George”, has called to … Continue reading →
